channel.title: [Class Suggestion] The Diplomat/The Ambassador
channel.description:
> # [color = "steblue"] The Diplomat [/color] :shield: > **[color = "steblue"] Blue Dragon Special [/color]** > Passive 1: Spare identity - If the prince dies before night 3 you will become a Prince with 2 executions > Passive 2: Hidden Chambers - Occupy and redirect immune. Anyone trying will think they succeeded > > Day Ability: Notice - Send an anonymous message to a player you have converted (2 uses) > > Night Ability 1: Negotiate - Convert target player to the blue dragon if they are neutral. They lose any passives that don't normally transfer. Cannot convert neutrals that have won already. BD neuts can be converted by the mastermind/cult leader or the ambassador. (Unlimited. 1 day cooldown) > Night Ability 2: Bide time - You will be convert immune tonight. Neutrals will be prevented from attacking you. (2 uses)
> # [color = "purple"] The Ambassador [/color] :shield: > **[color = "purple"] Unseen Social [/color]** > Passive 1: Pick up the torch - The Unseen will have a day chat while you are alive. If the Mastermind dies you will replace him. > Passive 2: Hidden Chambers - Occupy and redirect immune. Anyone trying will think they succeeded > > Day Ability: Message - Send target player an anonymous note. You may send as meny notes as you like per day. (unlimited) > > Night Ability 1: Discuss - Convert target neutral player to the Unseen. They will not count towards the faction cap and they will not meet with the unseen or be part of their chats. Only changes their goal and investigation results. Cannot convert neutrals that have won already (1 use) > Night Ability 2: Research - Learn target players class if they are unconvertable. (Unlimited)
Note: the neutral killer CAN be converted this way
Other Note: Converted neutrals are identical to their unconverted selves unless specified otherwise.

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Diplomat/The Ambassador
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
In otherwords NK’s are balenced with these problems in mind.

Observer see’s reaper on a delay, doesn’t see the possessor at all and the sorcerer has a cloak

All 3 can survive both a knight and hunter.

So that leaves just princess who can find them which is a much smaller risk than all 4

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Diplomat/The Ambassador
item.dc:creator: Icibalus
item.description:
nonetheless, SS, Scorned and winces Fool being convertable to BD is objectively bad
also the fact that the card basically says you can FUCKING MAKE THE NK BD

Read full topic

Exept the NK’s both have different wincons and ways to get around those

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Diplomat/The Ambassador
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Now the point isn’t that they always do this (if it was then converting them would be pointless). However it happens enough that calling them objectively scum is just false

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Diplomat/The Ambassador
item.dc:creator: Icibalus
item.description:
By that logic, Nuclear, all NKs should never kill and side with BD because they might get caught by Princess, Observer, Knight or Hunter.

Kills are risky, sure, but I’d argue killing as Alchemist is 100% worth it if you actually use your skill and judgement to determine whether killing someone is a good idea.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Diplomat/The Ambassador
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
It’s safer to just heal for towncredit and side with BD.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Diplomat/The Ambassador
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Not just that. It leaves you open to being caught by a princess, observer, Knight or Hunter.

The possibility of an instant loss and loss of leverage outweigh the rewards of a faster game

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Diplomat/The Ambassador
item.dc:creator: Icibalus
item.description:
All Neutrals except Inquisitor and Mercenary are objectively scum, because they basically have to harm Town in some way to win.

Even if you don’t say that, you’ve literally just cut off all the possibilities for the main scum factions to communicate with neutrals and convince them to side with them, because Diplomat exists.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: Icibalus
item.description:
Neutrals are scum Nuclear

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Diplomat/The Ambassador
item.dc:creator: Firekitten
item.description:
Icibalus:

also backup Prince isn’t bad if you actually read it, it’s just there’s something that makes people scream in terror when people include specific backups in their setups for some reason

This made me laugh

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Diplomat/The Ambassador
item.dc:creator: Icibalus
item.description:
Like Squire is the closest thing to Amnesiac i’d like to see in ToL, because I don’t think having a Neutral that can take alignments could be a good thing for the game, especially with the issue of convert caps and in-faction promotions.

Plus, it only adds swing, while having a Universal Backup only reduces swing.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Diplomat/The Ambassador
item.dc:creator: Icibalus
item.description:
however this class is bad because scum to town conversion is literally the worst fucking thing in Mafia ever

@RHCube btw here’s a ToL Amnesiac for ya:

The Squire

Blue Dragon Social

In Training (Passive) - You will survive the first time you are attacked in the first 3 nights.

In Their Footsteps (Night) - Choose a dead non-unique Blue Dragon player. You will become their class. (Infinite uses. 1 night cooldown)
BD goal

The Page

Unseen Social

In Training (Passive) - You will survive the first time you are attacked in the first 3 nights.

Correct Their Mistakes (Night) - Choose a dead non-unique Blue Dragon player. You will become the Unseen version of their class. (Infinite uses. 1 night cooldown)
Unseen goal

Credit goes to jammy, basically just the FoL class but with changges to how In Training works.

Read full topic
